abstract: A former Army surgeon who is also a consultant for a medical company has been accused of overstating the benefits of a product used in treating soldiers.
snippet: A former Army surgeon who is also a consultant for a medical company has been accused of overstating the benefits of a product used in treating soldiers.
lead_paragraph: A former surgeon at Walter Reed Army Medical Center, who is a paid consultant for a medical company, published a study that made false claims and overstated the benefits of the company’s product in treating soldiers severely injured in Iraq, the hospital’s commander said Tuesday.

headline.main: Doctor Falsified Study on Injured G.I.’s, Army Says
headline.print_headline: Doctor’s Study of Injured G.I.’s Made False Claims, Army Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

byline.original: By Duff Wilson and Barry Meier
